channel.title: Nostalgia on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.
channel.description: Recent content in Nostalgia on Tedium: The Dull Side of the Internet.

item.title: Command Line
item.description: Hey all, Ernie here with a fresh piece from David Buck, who has moved away from his NES for a while to tell you all about how awesome DOS is as a creative medium. Yeah, DOS. Today in Tedium: From the early 90s, up until 2005 or so, I did much of my computer gaming on an American Megatrends IBM PC, running MS-DOS and Windows 3.11. I even got online once using Netscape Communicator.

item.title: Christmas on Repeat
item.description: Editor’s note: This is a special Wednesday morning issue, in an effort to get ahead of your holiday travel. We’ll be back to our normal Tuesday/Thursday schedule next week. Today in Tedium: Every year, I have a tradition that I’ve followed pretty religiously for more than a decade. Whether in its original form or in its Mystery Science Theater 3000 send-up, I’ll watch the junk-culture film Santa Claus Conquers the Martians, despite knowing that the movie is perhaps one of the worst of all time.
